attributes.action: charge 'road tax' per 100cc rather than the current system of emmissions, which discriminates against older cars.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The current system of charging by emmissions only applies to cars manufactured after 01.03.2001 which means a 1.0L car registered before this date (which may only be driven a few miles per week) still pays the same rate of road tax as a brand new 3.5L Jaguar or 4.0L Jeep.

By changing the charge to an amount per 100cc, say £10, the 1.0L will pay £100 per annum & the 4.0L Jeep £400 irespective of the age of the car. 

Emmissions would still be part of the MOT, so those cars whose emmissions are too high would still be removed from the road and high mileage drivers will still pay more tax depending on the amount of fuel used.
